Reviews.Content: Not worth the money!! We thought we'd stay at the Ubud Village hotel over The Christmas period this year. The website was impressive and the rooms looked good. Because it was xmas we thought we'd splurge and pay for the super deluxe room with outdoor Balinese bathroom, private villa and breakfast thrown in. It has been a real disappointment. The room was only surface clean, the hotel has not looked after it well. It all looks a bit musty and run down. There is building work going on too, which starts at 8am even on Christmas morning!! The room has no charm to it. There are insects everywhere and no mosquito coils are provided for outside areas. Things regularly fell out of the roof onto our mosquito netting during the night. The bathrom had no hooks to hang our towels on and the towels wer small thin and greying badly. There was no shelf in the shower for shampoo etc and the shower head was partly blocked. The air con worked but was not nearly strong enough to cool the room down. The breakfast was poor quality, very little choice, reheated and terriblr stewed coffee or tea despite having an ILLY cofee machine which was never used. Overall it was a real let down and especially as our room was $189 a night, we satyed at the Intercontinental in Jakarta which was much superior, for less money!! Not really recommended, certainly not value for money.
Reviews.Author: JontiDenHaag

Reviews.Content: Great hotel and location Great location on Monkey Forest Road, close to good restaurants like Cafe Wayan and Lotus Lane. Friendly staff, nice clean rooms.
Reviews.Author: trvlmom2

Reviews.Content: In one word - grotty Stayed here for 2 nights in August - was upgraded to a villa - but my overriding impression was of a place well past its prime. The fixtures and fittings were worn out and grotty, the room  garden area was not clean, the mosquito netting torn and grubby and if you were looking for privacy forget it - I could hear the conversation of the guests in the neighbouring villa as I was lying in bed. Totally overpriced, no value for money. Stayed at the Uma Ubud the previous time and will definitely return there next time.
Reviews.Author: libica

Reviews.Content: Good location, not so good for the rest! This hotel has a great location. I stayed at this hotel last year and it was in much better condition. This year we really noticed it was run down. We stayed in one of the Villas both times we stayed at Ubud Village, this time for 3 nights. We bargained down the price to $120 from $150 (USD) per night. And we are glad we did! The Villas are much nicer than the regular rooms since they have the traditional style outside bathrooms and beds with the canopy etc. The room comes with the optional use of 2 robes they provide hanging in the closets. They smelled like mold, so we didn't use them. I also had huge puffy eyes the whole time i stayed here. I think i may have been allergic to all the mold. Anyway, the hotel seems to not have enough pool towels, and the chairs outside are falling apart. There is no staff working the pool bar, massage tables, and no staff working the pool at all. I know it is the low season, so maybe that is why. The free breakfast is ok, but we did leave and eat at another excellent restaurant (Wyan's cafe) next door one morning. Also, the breakfast staff seem extremely unhappy to be working there! They seem unhelpful and annoyed when you ask for things or help.
Reviews.Author: advisor22SanDiego

Reviews.Content: Hotel Hell Booked this trip through Sayang Holidays. Bali is great, but Ubud, not so much. This is our saga while in Ubud:1st night, no sleep because villa next door played music all night. Roof is grass, music came right in. Next day we were moved to another room.2nd night, no sleep because AC was loud and bugs fells on our chests while in bed including a 6 long snake/worm from the rotting ceiling above.3rd night, ants fell on us from the ceiling at several times throughout the night. Moved to another room the next morning.4th night, moved to a room up out of the ravine and on flat land. Went to bed, but reggae music immediately started from the bar down the street. Front desk reports this has happened for the last several years and they can't do anything about it. Demand to be moved out of the hotel. They move us to the Ubud Village RESORT, outside of town. Slept for the first time in 3+ days. Also, the Ubud Village HOTEL is tearing up their front entrance to put in a restaurant, and the pool is to be rebuilt in the next year...DO NOT GO HERE.
Reviews.Author: oaklanddba

Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, great hotel       pathway to my hotel room in UVH

Reviews.Content: great location but worn out hotel Stayed in Ubud village Hotel in November last year. The location of Hotel is great but the rooms and toilets are pretty worn out. The basin has stains and outlet cover is rusty. The wc section have a stench of urine smell and the room is poorly lit by a white flourescence tube and some PL lights. Floor is dusty. I would not stay here again. The management here have some very serious housekeeping issues to resolve.

Reviews.Content: Close to everything The room was lovely with a view to the rice fields.The food at the restaurant was very good and reasonably priced. It was very central to shopping, markets, palace, monkey forest etc. We only stayed for 3 nights but we had a lovely time in Ubud.

On a budget this trip with the kids we found it to be inexpensive but with excellent facilities and the best in rooms. The staff are friendly and very helpful. We have stayed here three times now and will probably be back in September. Thanks to the staff and to Christina for getting us a really good room rate. See you soon. Cheers. Kerrie Mills

Reviews.Content: Love my vacation I stayed here on december 2005.The location is on the heart of jl monkey forest street,so you can go anywhere easily. First impression of this hotel is friendly.They have a well trained and very friendly staff.I feel the real balinese hospitality when I stayed here.The room was much more than I expected for $60, very comfortable,clean, ceiling fan,air conditioner ,Television with a sattelite channel and a small beautiful garden on the front of the room . They also have a big enough swimming pool.They also provide a afternoon tea with balinese cake everyday for free.The restaurant is gergeous,balinese architecture with a delicious food.I highly recommended this hotel for a budget traveler($60-80).

Reviews.Content: we love this place, our 2nd home This was the 7th time in six years we stayed in the Ubud Village Hotel.We always find a warm welcome. The kind staff feels almost as family.We like the rooms which are good and not expensive. The poolside and the garden is beautiful/peacefull.If there麓s incidentely something that needs to be fixed, a half word is enough and it will be fixed.In a few minutes walk you can visit the famous Ubud-market and the most wonderfull ricefield area麓s.The only thing we regret is the videoscreen in the restaurant in the evening. But that doesn麓t bother us because there are lots of alternatives in the direct neighbourhood.Go find out yourself, you will not be dissapointed!We sure will come back to this place.Sorry for my English, but the message is clear, I suppose.Joost and Ludwig, Holland.

Reviews.Content: Taking the whole family back It was just right. The atmosphere 100%. The forest at the back door. The outdoor bathrooms and living rooms were so Bali it was super. So central I could shop and Geoff could swim and we were only a few minutes apart. The markets were not far; great all day but amazing early in the morning with all the produce. The staff were helpful and the food was good. Central to local restaurants for eating out. In April 06 we're taking the whole family back...9 of us. Thats how much we loved it.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: The most wonderful hotel in center of ubud
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: honeymoon nightmare Good to see that Ubud Village has maintained its 'high' standards! As per the previous review we stayed here as part of our honeymoon and in comparison to other hotels (that on average were all 3-star rating)it was dismal.We also had the delightful honeymoon suite of two single beds in the dingiest room in the corner of the property with delightful view of the satellite dish beautifully illuminated by stark flourescent lighting.What was most upsetting was the absolute lack of care from staff to the situation or offer of any options. Only after I became extremely angry were we offered a different room the next day but I hated the fact that I had to act like that to achieve any response.The alternative room was only marginally better- very dim and dank.We spent most our time away from the hotel exploring ubud which is such a fantastic place.This holiday was booked and paid for far in advance and clearly stated we were on our honeymoon.Having returned many times to Bali I would recommend Komaneka accross the road which is more expensive but an exceptional hotel in the heart of ubud. For a very romantic hotel in the centre of ubud also try The Ibah- outstanding.Yes you will pay more but I go in the low season and these hotels always offer good deals.
Reviews.Author: sydneymolly

Reviews.Content: Not Happy Here Every hotel experience we had on our honeymoon in Bali was wonderful - except at the Ubud Village. After calling the previous day to confirm our arrival time of 2 pm, we were told on arrival that our room would not be ready until 8 pm, or possibly later. When our room finally was ready, it had virtually no working lights, the tv and air con remotes were not working, and we had two small single beds (we had told them that it was our honeymoon!). The staff was not helpful. We switched hotels the next day.
Reviews.Author: jeremy_bentham

Reviews.Content: the Superior Villa was great It was central to everywhere you want to shop and good restaurants all around. (Try Lamak and Wayman cafe across the street.) The staff was professional and cheerful. The Superior Villa is luxury for those on a midsized budget. Sheets were fresh everyday. The mini fridge was stocked with drinks. I didnt mind the outside 2 person bath tub and shower. The pool and garden area was well kept. only ate at the restaurant for breakfast which was average. I would return again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Not enamoured This hotel has a decent design and layout but is let down by lax service standards and a lack of attention to small, but important, details.None of this would have bothered me if I hadn't already stayed in the superior and much more professionally-run Bali Spirit Hotel two years earlier at only US$65 a night. Anyway, at the Ubud Village Hotel, I stayed in superior room. A few problems I noted were:1. The grubby appearance of the room.It looked great in the picture, but less so in reality. My feet were black with dust after half an hour of walking around, unpacking my clothes. I don't think the floor had seen a mop in weeks. The bathroom towels were ones I would not use in my own home, let alone a hotel. They were faded and frayed from years of use. The bedding smelled musty and the floor mats had clearly seen better days. The toilet smelled of, well, pee. There were two batik-style robes hanging in the wardrobe, but I didn't dare wear them for fear that they hadn't been washed in a while. Also, only 3 coathangers? At US$80 a night, this hotel can afford a few extra.2. The breakfast areaIt's next to the road - which is great, if you don't mind the smell of diesel and the sound of roaring traffic and motorbikes with your tea and toast. On the subject of food, I only ate scrambled eggs. Why? Because the rest of the breakfast food (a minimal selection of three or four items, like overcooked bacon and hash browns) was left uncovered and had flies buzzing around it. The bread (only brown and white slices) was luckily covered. The staff on duty were, in my opinion, too young, untrained and unmotivated. Everything was an effort for them. I arrived one day for breakfast at 7-30am to find that the milk had run out and no-one had bothered to buy any more. When pressed by another guest, a staff member went out to a nearby supermarket and bought some. Come on, it's 7-30am and there's no milk?? 3. Middle of Monkey Forest RoadDon't be fooled. It's a long, long walk to Jalan Raya Ubud - the main street with the best restaurants. The Bali Spirit might be further out, but it provides regular free transport right to the centre of town and back again. The location of the Ubud Village Hotel is definitely not worth US$80 a night.Conclusion: I have no idea what justifies the US$80 a night price tag when other hotels provide a lot more for a lot less. A little investment in towels, bedding, mats, cleaning materials and breakfast equipment would not go amiss.I wouldn't stay at the Ubud Village Hotel again - not unless it gets its act together.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great hotel in Central Ubud We stayed at this hotel in February 2005. The Ubud Village Hotel is a great place to stay if you want luxury hotel features (which in Bali means things like air-conditioning) while being near the center of town, rather than staying out in one of the more isolated destination resorts (like the Four Seasons at Sayan). Many/most of the luxury hotels are outside of Ubud village center -- places like the Four Seasons at Sayan (a 10 min drive away). The Ubud Village Hotel is on Monkey Forest Road about a 5 min walk from Ubud Center (the Ubud Palace) so it's very centrally located. Price is also better than the other full luxury resorts; we paid US$80/night for two, which included breakfast and taxes. The hotel itself is a beautifully designed, small tropical resort (this is an intimate place, not one of those enormous resorts with hundreds of guests). Rooms are large and spacious with air conditioning, cable TV, minibar, etc. The bathroom is outside in its own private little patio -- half open to the sky but very private. Rooms are accessed through outdoor walkways and individual courtyards. Rooms are far enough back from the road to be very quiet. Construction is a modern interpretation of traditional Bali materials -- wood and stonework. The landscaping is beautiful, with an interior courtyard with fountain and a lovely swimming pool. The hotel has several pleasant covered bar/seating areas. The hotel serves breakfast but I don't know if it serves lunch/dinner. Laundry service and some spa services are available. Outside of the hotel -- you are steps from several nice bars / restaurants right next to the hotel (Bali Pesto, etc. -- see www.balieats.com for restaurant recommendations). If you're willing to walk 5-10 minutes, you have access to literally dozens of shops and restaurants of all types in Ubud. There are always several performances in Ubud at night (Balinese dance, puppet show etc) and you can walk to the venues from the hotel. A short taxi ride (there are always drivers hanging about, asking if you want transport) will get you to any of the locations that are too far to easily walk (including the museums, Elephant Cave/temple, and other shops/restaurants/resorts in the greater Ubud area). The only potential downside to this hotel was the outside bathroom, especially at night. This is the tropics, and sometimes when we went out into the bathroom, we found a caterpillar or a few ants or a flying bug or something in the bathroom. This wasn't a big problem for us, but if you're the type of person who can't stand bugs at all, then you might want to go for a hotel with an interior bathroom. Also, this doesn't seem like a great hotel for families with small children -- there's not much for kids to do, other than play in the swimming pool. This is more of a hotel for adults looking for a quiet restful place.
Reviews.Author: hibachi
